DOC.brief_summary: The pneumoperitoneum during laparoscopic surgery in pediatrics has the potential to cause an increase of intracranial pressure (ICP). Previous studies have proposed that ultrasonographic measurements of the optic nerve sheath diameter (ONSD) correlate with signs of increased ICP. Therefore, this study aims to confirm the increased ICP by ultrasonographic measurement of ONSD during laparoscopic surgery in pediatric patients.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Pneumoperitoneum on Intracranial Pressure in Pediatric Laparoscopic Surgery: Ultrasonographic Measurement of Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
DOC.criteria: 1. pediatric patients (under 9 yrs) scheduled for undergoing laparoscopic surgery under general anesthesia 1. Patients with previous history of neurologic disease or neurosurgery, ocular disease or ocular surgery
